# Corpay (CPAY) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

Corpay (NYSE: CPAY) is a global S&P500 corporate payments company that helps businesses and consumers pay expenses in a simple, controlled manner. The company was formerly known as FLEETCOR Technologies, Inc. and changed its name to Corpay, Inc. in March 2024. Corpay, Inc. was founded in 1986 and is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia.

Corpay's business is organized into three main segments. The Corporate Payments segment focuses on streamlining back-office vendor payment operations. Its accounts payable automation solutions can handle everything from simple small business needs to complex enterprise requirements, initiating and managing payments through various methods including ACH, wire, check, or payment cards. The company's Virtual Card solution provides single-use card numbers for specific amounts within defined timeframes, while its Cross-Border solutions help customers pay international vendors and manage currency exchange risks. The Lodging Payments segment helps businesses control accommodation costs through three primary verticals: workforce, airlines, and insurance. For workforce clients, Corpay provides comprehensive travel booking and management. For airlines, it offers crew layover management and disruption handling for stranded passengers.

Corpay's suite of modern payment solutions help its customers better manage vehicle-related expenses (such as fueling and parking), travel expenses (e.g., hotel bookings) and payables (e.g., paying vendors). This results in customers saving time and ultimately spending less.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

The company offers vehicle payment solutions, which include fuel, tolls, parking, vehicle compliance, fleet maintenance, and long-haul transportation services, as well as prepaid food and transportation vouchers and cards.

It also provides corporate payment solutions consisting of accounts payable AP automation; virtual cards, cross-border solutions; and purchasing and T&E travel and entertainment card products, as well as lodging payments solutions for employees who travel overnight for work purposes; traveling crews and stranded passengers from airlines and cruise lines; and insurance policyholders displaced from their homes due to damage or catastrophe; workforce lodging solutions for business travel programs; airline logistics, crew management, insurance, and other payments solutions.

In addition, the company offers gifts and payroll cards. It serves business, merchant, consumer, and payment network customers.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

Corpay is pursuing opportunities in the stablecoin space: The company's three-pronged stablecoin strategy includes enabling stablecoin wallets for merchants and beneficiaries, integrating stablecoin capabilities into MCA and Alpha Global Banks Accounts

They will work together to embed USDC across Corpay's cross-border pay-in and pay-out rails allowing companies to access blockchain's 24/7 settlement and programmability. Integrated Access to USDC: Corpay will integrate Circle Mint and related APIs, enabling clients to access and manage USDC directly through Corpay's platform. USDC Wallets Built Into Customer Accounts: Clients will be able to fund Corpay-branded digital wallets—powered by Circle Wallets—instantly, enabling onchain settlement and seamless currency conversion alongside traditional fiat balances.

The Alpha acquisition brings a high-performing core business with a 42% CAGR from 2021-2024 and increases Corpay's corporate payments mix, with 2026 corporate payments revenue projected to exceed $2 billion, representing over 40% of total revenue. The acquisition also provides entry into the investment managers segment and adds alternative banking capabilities.

## 5. Growth Strategy

Corpay aims to expand its corporate payments revenue to $10 billion. Management believes Corpay can become a $10 billion business, or five times its current size, propelled by midteens organic revenue growth and ongoing M&A.

Looking ahead to 2026, Corpay provided this financial preview: The company expects organic revenue growth of 9%-11% in 2026, supported by an improved macroeconomic environment with better FX rates and lower interest rates.

Corpay's 2025 strategy is a masterclass in long-term value creation. By combining high-impact M&A with ecosystem alliances, the company is building a fortress of capabilities that competitors can't easily replicate. The Alpha Group acquisition as detailed in corporate news and AvidXchange investment according to investor presentations are not just financial transactions-they're strategic bets on the future of global commerce.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

Corpay serves more than 800,000 business customers globally, processing over $145 billion in transactions annually. They work with 200 countries in over 140 currencies.

By acquiring AvidXchange, Corpay isn't just expanding its customer base-it's embedding itself into the supply chains of Fortune 500 companies. The AvidXchange investment provides access to an attractive business with 24% revenue CAGR from 2020-2024, complementary verticals, and a vendor payment network of over 1.4 million vendors.

Corpay serves industries such as education, healthcare, hospitality, manufacturing, and other sectors requiring efficient payment systems. Corpay's offerings are particularly valuable to industries such as education, healthcare, hospitality, and manufacturing, where efficient payment systems are critical to operational success.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

### Q3 2025 Results
Corpay reported adjusted earnings per share of $5.70 in Q3 2025, up 14% year-over-year, on revenues of $1.17 billion, which also increased 14% compared to the same period last year. CPAY's earnings per share of $5.7 beat the consensus estimate by 1.2% and rose 14% year over year. The total revenues of $1.2 billion surpassed the consensus estimate by a slight margin and gained 13.9% from the year-ago quarter.

### Financial Strength
Corpay highlighted its strong balance sheet and financial flexibility, which provides capacity for continued strategic investments: The company reported $677 million of adjusted EBITDA and generated $405 million of free cash flow in the quarter. Total liquidity stood at $3.5 billion as of September 30, 2025, including $1.4 billion of borrowing capacity and $2.0 billion of unrestricted cash. The leverage ratio improved to 2.40x, down from 2.75x in Q4 2024, placing it within the company's target range.

### Guidance
For 2025, CPAY raised the revenue guidance to $4.51-$4.53 billion compared with the preceding quarter's view of $4.41-$4.49 billion. The guided range is higher than the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $4.46 billion. The guidance for adjusted net income per diluted share was raised to $21.14-$21.34 compared with $20.86-$21.26 from the preceding quarter. The guided range is higher than the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $21.10.

## 10. Comparison to Competitors

### WEX
WEX is perhaps Corpay's most direct competitor, offering similar fleet payment and corporate payment solutions. Corpay has higher revenue and earnings than WEX. Corpay is trading at a lower price-to-earnings ratio than WEX, indicating that it is currently the more affordable of the two stocks.

Corpay and WEX are both universal fuel cards, meaning they're accepted at a broad range of fuel stations across the U.S. However, WEX has wider acceptance, with coverage at 95% of U.S. gas stations which is an estimated 160,000 locations compared to Corpay's 60,000 participating stations.

### Bill.com
In the accounts payable automation segment, Corpay faces competition from specialized providers like BILL, AVDX, and privately-held Tipalti.

### Cross-border payments
In the cross-border payments market, Corpay competes with established players like WU and WISE.L (Wise), as well as banking institutions offering international payment services.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

### Recent Acquisitions
**AvidXchange (October 2025)**: Corpay, Inc. (NYSE: CPAY), the corporate payments company, today announced along with TPG, that they have completed the take-private transaction for AvidXchange Holdings, Inc., announced on May 6, 2025. Corpay invested approximately $550 million for a 34% equity stake in the company. Notably, Corpay has secured an option to acquire 100% of the company in three years.

**Alpha Group (November 2025)**: Corpay, Inc. (NYSE: CPAY), the corporate payments company, completed the acquisition of Alpha Group International plc (LSE: ALPH), a B2B cross border FX solutions and global bank accounts provider to corporations and investment funds for $2.4 billion.

### Strategic Partnerships
**Mastercard Partnership**: Mastercard and Corpay today announced an expansion of their partnership to deliver an enhanced suite of corporate cross-border payment solutions. Under the agreement, Mastercard will become a minority investor in Corpay's cross-border business. The $300 million investment – for an approximately 3% equity stake – represents an enterprise valuation of $10.7 billion, or 20x forward EBITDA multiple.

**Circle Collaboration**: Corpay, Inc., (NYSE: CPAY), the corporate payments company, has announced a new collaboration with a subsidiary of ... CRCL), a global fintech firm, to expand stablecoin access across global payment channels. They will work together to embed USDC across Corpay's cross-border pay-in and pay-out rails allowing companies to access blockchain's 24/7 settlement and programmability.

Based on the comprehensive analysis, Corpay presents a compelling investment opportunity with strong fundamentals, strategic positioning in high-growth payment markets, successful M&A execution, and robust financial performance. The company's transformation from a fleet-focused business to a comprehensive corporate payments provider, combined with strategic partnerships with Mastercard and Circle, positions it well for continued growth. While there are some headwinds in the lodging segment and concerns about acquisition integration, the overall outlook remains positive with strong analyst support and projected double-digit growth rates.

Corpay is a global corporate payments company that helps businesses manage expenses through innovative payment solutions across vehicle, travel, and corporate payment segments. The company has strategically transformed from a fleet-focused business to a comprehensive payments platform, executing key acquisitions (AvidXchange, Alpha Group) and forming critical partnerships with Mastercard and Circle to expand cross-border and blockchain payment capabilities. With strong organic revenue growth across corporate and vehicle payment segments, Corpay aims to expand corporate payments revenue to $10 billion through midteens organic growth and strategic M&A. The company processes over $145 billion in annual transactions across 200 countries and serves 800,000 business customers. Major growth initiatives include stablecoin integration, expanding international payment rails, and leveraging recent acquisitions to enter new market segments like investment management.

The AI investment rating is 8.2/10 with a fair value estimate of $375, reflecting strong fundamentals, strategic positioning, and projected double-digit growth potential in the corporate payments market.
